discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
D and E

choices.E: Ensure the team understands they need a Definition of Done.
choices.D: Ask the Product Owner to discuss the product, its vision, history, goals, and context, as well answer questions.
choices.C: Introduce a bonus system for the top performers in the team.
choices.B: Ensure the Scrum Team members have compatible personalities.
choices.A: Have the manager for each Developer introduce their direct reports to go over their responsibilities on the Scrum Team.

questions.question_text: You are the Scrum Master on a newly formed Scrum Team. Which two of the following activities would probably help the team in starting up? (Choose two.)
Which outcome is expected as Scrum Teams mature?

choices.E: A Scrum Master is no longer needed since they are a mature team now.
choices.D: Sprint Reviews will no longer be needed.
choices.B: The Sprint Retrospectives will grow to be longer than 4 hours.
choices.A: They will improve their definition of ג€Doneג€ to include more stringent criteria.
choices.C: There is no need for a time-boxed Sprint.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A

Selected Answer: A
With more functional requirements comes the non functional requirements.These non functional requirements are added to Definition of Done and it become more stringent.

Answer A - The Scrum team is responsible for all product-related activities from Stakeholder collaboration, verification, maintenance, operation, experimentation, R&D, and anything else that might be required.

questions.question_text: Who is responsible for collaboration with stakeholders? (Choose the best answer.)
Who determines how many Product Backlog items the Developers select for a Sprint? (Сhoose the best answer.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Developers pull items from product backlog.

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A

According to ChatGPT "he best answer for what enhances the transparency of an Increment in Scrum is:

A. Doing all work needed to meet the Definition of Done.

The Definition of Done (DoD) is a crucial aspect in Scrum, as it provides a clear and shared understanding of what it means for work to be complete. "

Selected Answer: A
Every action item needs to fulfill Definition of Done before it is considered complete.
Answer is A - The definition of Done creates transparency by providing everyone a shared understanding of what was completed as part of the increment.

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer

choices.D: Reporting Sprint progress to the stakeholders daily.
choices.B: Updating Sprint tasks properly in the electronic tracking tool.
choices.A: Doing all work needed to meet the Definition of Done.
choices.C: Keeping track of and estimating all undone work to be completed in a 'hardening' Sprint.
